    • Use RApsimNG to modify apximx file

Use RApsimNG to modify apximx file

Bangyou Zheng

2020-07-30

Source: vignettes/vignettes.Rmd
vignettes.Rmd

The RApsimNG is designed to modify and run the *.apsimx simulations using R.

Read APSIMX file

The wheat.apsimx in the validation dataset of APSIM NG is used as an example. Function read_apsimx is used to read *.apsimx file through jsonlite::read_json and returns as a list.

# Read Wheat.apsimx file with `read_apsimx` which returns a list of json results.
file <- system.file("wheat.apsimx", package = "RApsimNG")
m <- read_apsimx(file)

Search by of APSIM NG

A node in the apsimx file can be found using the path specification in APSIM NG.

potential <- search_path(m,
    path = '[Structure].BranchingRate.PotentialBranchingRate.Vegetative.PotentialBranchingRate')
potential
#> $node
#> $node$`$type`
#> [1] "Models.Functions.LinearInterpolationFunction, Models"
#> 
#> $node$Name
#> [1] "PotentialBranchingRate"
#> 
#> $node$Children
#> $node$Children[[1]]
#> $node$Children[[1]]$`$type`
#> [1] "Models.Functions.XYPairs, Models"
#> 
#> $node$Children[[1]]$X
#> $node$Children[[1]]$X[[1]]
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $node$Children[[1]]$X[[2]]
#> [1] 2
#> 
#> $node$Children[[1]]$X[[3]]
#> [1] 3
#> 
#> $node$Children[[1]]$X[[4]]
#> [1] 4
#> 
#> $node$Children[[1]]$X[[5]]
#> [1] 5
#> 
#> $node$Children[[1]]$X[[6]]
#> [1] 6
#> 
#> $node$Children[[1]]$X[[7]]
#> [1] 7
#> 
#> $node$Children[[1]]$X[[8]]
#> [1] 8
#> 
#> 
#> $node$Children[[1]]$Y
#> $node$Children[[1]]$Y[[1]]
#> [1] 0
#> 
#> $node$Children[[1]]$Y[[2]]
#> [1] 0
#> 
#> $node$Children[[1]]$Y[[3]]
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $node$Children[[1]]$Y[[4]]
#> [1] 2

#> [1] 4

#> [1] 7

Run apsimx file

A function run_models is wrapped for APSIM NG Models.exe in the command line and can be called to run apsimx files. See APSIM website for documentation.
